Read our new report for more on how FCRA changed this, helping Congress effectively support communities across the country with both direct loans and loan guarantees. ⤵
https://budget.house.gov/publications/report/budgeting-and-federal-credit-reform-act-1990-explainer

Before the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990 (FCRA), direct loans appeared more expensive than guaranteed loans.

This encouraged Congress to create guaranteed loan programs not because they better served the taxpayer — but to lower the cost on paper.

Direct loans are paid directly to individuals and businesses (such as disaster assistance).

Guaranteed loans are paid through private lenders, with payments guaranteed by the government (such as VA mortgages).
Understanding the true cost of this spending helps Congress allocate resources effectively — and helps the American people evaluate how their government serves them.

From mortgages for veterans to disaster assistance and rural infrastructure, federal loans provide assistance to families across America.

But for decades Congress did not have a way to accurately compare different loan programs. 🧵

RT @TechNetUpdate .@RepMcCaul: Thank you for your leadership in getting the #CHIPS and Science Act across the finish line. Your hard work and commitment paves the way for a new era of good-paying jobs and innovation across central TX and the U.S. https://twitter.com/RepMcCaul/status/1550590454558760967 QT @RepMcCaul Passing the CHIPS Act is critical to our national security. I urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to join me in voting for this critical bill. 

My statement ⬇️ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FYTMQfsWAAAiYpy.png

I worked on this bill with @DrLauraBerman & Samuel Chapman, the parents of Sammy Chapman, a 16-year-old who died from an overdose in his bedroom after buying fentanyl-laced Xanax from a drug dealer on @Snapchat, and Marc Berkman, CEO of @socialmedsafety.

Social media platforms allow for drugs to be ordered on demand — like Amazon Prime or a pizza delivery. Kids don’t even have to leave their neighborhoods, let alone their houses. We also know that China and TikTok have access to our kids’ and Americans’ private data.

The Combating Harmful Actions with Transparency on Social (CHATS) Act takes steps to hold social media companies accountable, combat dangers to our kids, and boost transparency into which apps — whether it’s @Snapchat, @instagram, or @tiktok_us — are being used for which crimes.

The lack of transparency and accountability for social media companies has led to grave consequences for our kids, families, and national security. That’s why I introduced the bipartisan CHATS Act w/ @RepBrianFitz.
 
Read how we can protect our kids now👇
